Posts.Content: Dec 16, 2010 08:47PM FloridaGirl wrote: I just had BMX with immediate reconstruction using the lat muscles from my back on 12/10.  I was nervous going into the surgery and wondering if I had made the right choice.  I think I did, I am definitely sore in the back, but it is bearable.  Every day, I feel better than the day before and can go longer without the Percocet.  When I was first diagnosed with DCIS in Oct. my surgeon said we would take care of it with lumpectomy followed by radiation.  After receiving a 2nd opinion and because I have such dense, active breasts that were hard to read, and also being told the cancer was very close to the nipple and radiaion whould shrink in the breast area even more after the lumpectomy, I was given the choice of mastectomy.  First, just the cancer side, then suggesting both sides since I would always be having biopsies and questions about the other side.  These were all my decisions, but every time I went to the Dr. I felt the news kept getting worse and worse.  But now, that the surgery is behind me, I feel I made the right choice and won't have too worry too much in the future.  My surgery was skin sparing, and PS rebuilt the nipples and areola.
Posts.Title: Home from Surgury Sue4LSU CrunchyPoodleMama

Posts.Content: Dec 23, 2010 01:36PM FloridaGirl wrote: westieluv - so sorry to hear what all you have been through.  I had my skin sparing BMX with immediate reconstruction on the same day as your original surgery.  I have also been having chills all the time, but not a fever.  When I'm on tylenol, the chills get better.  I so hope I don't have an underlying infection.  My last two drains came out this afternoon and one area was very sore and red, so I'm hoping that was the cause of the chills.  I was so ready for those last two drains to come out - I already feel like a new person.  The lattisimus dorsi flap surgery for me hasn't been too bad.  I can do more with my arms than I had anticipated being 13 days post-surgery.  Yes, it is uncomfortable, but should get better with each passing day.
Posts.Title: December 2010 Mastectomy zogo fire-dancer

Posts.Content: Jan 7, 2011 10:05AM FloridaGirl wrote: Awwww.  I'm at the 4 week mark from BMX with immediate reconstruction using the LD muscle.  Recovery is going well, the only real issue I'm having is the nipple reconstruction is not looking so good and will probably need revision at least on one side.  Because I live so far from the PS, I am following up with a local surgeon and he scraped the black deadness off the nipple yesterday and took a culture, because it looks so pus-filled underneath and the nipple on that side is disfigued and small.  I follow up with an oncologist on the 14th, and I'm hoping that chemo will not be in my future.  I'll report back after that.  I am another with very dense breasts and multiple mamos, ultrasounds and biopsies.  I think what really triggered my most recent biopsy that discovered the DCIS on the left side, was the nipple discharge I had been having for the past 8 months.  Even though it had been analyzed twice and came back as OK, it really made the radiologist take a much closer look at me.  Thankfully, I can put all this behind me soon. Thinking about you other women and wishing you the best.
Posts.Title: December 2010 Mastectomy zogo fire-dancer

Posts.Content: Dec 20, 2010 04:54PM FloridaGirl wrote: I am 10 days on the other side.  I also suffered from the constipation and was unable to go for the first 6 days after.  I have been taking Colace x 2 twice a day, drinking hot tea or coffee, eating dried plums (which are quite tasty) and have finally had success 3 times.  The very first time was difficult and I had to push like I was having a baby. I am so tight and sore in the chest and back and wasn't sent home with exercises or stretches to do, so not sure what to do or not to do.  I have been lounging in my pj's every day, but managed to walk around the yard today for 10 minutes.  It could be I'm not moving enough.  Tomorrow, I go back (4 hour drive) to the Drs. and should get my path report and I will be asking for post op instructions/exercises.  I will get some exercise then walking from the parking garage to the Drs. office. Hope to get all 6 drain tubes out tomorrow also.  The only support bra I can wear is the one they had me in after surgery.  All others are way to tight. I can get myself into bed to lay down, but can not get myself out of bed so have to wake DH in the middle of the night to help me up because I can't go more than 6 hours w/o peeing. Some nights it is easier to sleep in the recliner so I have more independence.
Posts.Title: December 2010 Mastectomy zogo fire-dancer

Posts.Content: Dec 27, 2010 08:08AM FloridaGirl wrote: NancyFL - Yes, I'm in the panhandle and had my surgery at UAB which was the closest place for me that also did the skin sparing reconstruction aspect of the surgery.  I feel very fortunate that my HMO insurance let me travel out-of-state. Otherwise, I probably would have traveled to Gainesville or Tampa.  I am really healing up faster than anticipated.  I have tons of swelling in the breast area and I wear a compression bra 24/7.  I was instructed to for the first 6 weeks.  At first, the surgical bra they had me in after surgery was the only one that would work, but just in the past couple days I can now wear a JCP Sports Bra.  It is very snug and uncomfortable, but this too will pass.  I still have numbness on my back and sock like feeling under my arms (from the lattisimus dorsi procedure). I'm still going to take it pretty slow and easy this week. Hope you continue the great healing.  Paula and Jacqueline - Will be thinking of you this week and praying for a smooth recovery.
Posts.Title: December 2010 Mastectomy zogo fire-dancer

Posts.Content: Jan 12, 2011 04:47PM FloridaGirl wrote: I'm a lucky one - went to the oncologist today and heard it from the expert's mouth that I do not need chemo.  And he prescribed Tamoxifen (I'm 50, but pre-menopause).  I can live with that and he said for me doing the BMX probably cured me 95%.  Good news.  Now I just have to get my reconstructed nipples to heal.  It has been almost 5 weeks and one looks really icky, but the PS said it could take another 2-3 weeks of healing. Heading back to work next week.
Posts.Title: December 2010 Mastectomy zogo fire-dancer

Posts.Content: Dec 16, 2010 07:07PM FloridaGirl wrote: My fist post on this site.  I had my skin sparing BMX with immediate reconstruction using the lattisimus dorsi muscle and slicone gel implants on Dec. 10. Today I am not feeling too bad, trying to wean off the pain meds and taking only two percocet within 24 hour period.  I most definitely am sore and tight in the back and have the iron bra feeling.  Each day seems easier than the day before.  I have 6 drain tubes and the collection has decreased today.
Posts.Title: December 2010 Mastectomy zogo fire-dancer
